worms.model
Class World

java.lang.Object
  worms.model.World

public class World
extends java.lang.Object

A class representing a world in the game 'Worms'.

Author:
Emil Loevbak, Victor Le Pochat
Invariants:
  • The value of width must be a valid width as per isValidWidth.
        isValidWidth(this.getWidth())
  • The value of height must be a valid width as per isValidHeight.
        isValidHeight(this.getHeight())

    • Constructor Summary

    Constructor Detail

    World

    @Raw
public World(double width,
                 double height,
                 boolean[][] passableMap,
                 java.util.Random random)
    Creates a world an initializes it with the provided parameters.

    Parameters:
    width - The width that the world should have.
    height - The height that the world should have.
    passableMap - A 2D-array of booleans representing the passable areas of the map linked to this world.
    random - The random number generator to be used in this world.
    Effects:
  • The new world's height is set to the given value.
        this.setWidth(width)
  • The new world's width is set to the given value.
        this.setHeight(height)
    • Postconditions:
  • worms, food and projectiles are initialized as empty sets
        new.worms instanceof Set && new.worms.size() == 0
        new.food instanceof Set && new.food.size() == 0
        new.projectiles instanceof Set && new.projectiles.size() == 0
  • The passable map of this world is equal to the provided passable map.
        new.passableMap == passableMap
  • The random number generator used in this world is equal to the provided random number generator.
        new.random == random
    • Method Detail

    isImpassable

    public boolean isImpassable(double x,
                            double y,
                            double radius)
    Determines whether a certain area of the world is impassable for an object with a certain position and radius.

    Parameters:
    x - The x-coordinate of the area to check.
    y - The y-coordinate of the area to check.
    radius - The radius of the object for which to check.
    Returns:
    True if the given area is impassable for an object of the given radius or the provided coordinates are out of range.
        isImpassableDiscrete(Math.floor(x/getWidth()*getPassableMap()[0].length), Math.floor((1.0-y/getHeight())*getPassableMap().length), Math.abs(Math.floor(radius/getWidth()*getPassableMap()[0].length)))

    isAdjacent

    public boolean isAdjacent(double x,
                          double y,
                          double radius)
    Checks whether a certain object at the given location is adjacent to an impassable part of this world.

    Parameters:
    x - The x-coordinate to check.
    y - The y-coordinate to check.
    radius - The radius of the object to check for.
    Returns:
    True If the location is passable and within 0.1*radius of an impassable location.
        (! isImpassable(x, y, radius)) && for any i in Math.floor(x/getWidth()*getPassableMap()[0].length)-Math.abs(Math.floor(0.1*radius/getWidth()*getPassableMap()[0].length))..Math.floor(x/getWidth()*getPassableMap()[0].length)+Math.abs(Math.floor(0.1*radius/getWidth()*getPassableMap()[0].length)):
         (for any j in Math.floor((1.0-y/getHeight())*getPassableMap().length)-Math.abs(Math.floor(0.1*radius/getHeigt()*getPassableMap().length))..Math.floor((1.0-y/getHeight())*getPassableMap().length)+Math.abs(Math.floor(0.1*radius/getHeigt()*getPassableMap().length)):
         (inRadius(Math.abs(i-Math.floor(x/getWidth()*getPassableMap()[0].length)), Math.abs(j-Math.floor((1.0-y/getHeight())*getPassableMap().length)), Math.abs(Math.floor(0.1*radius/getWidth()*getPassableMap()[0].length))) && (isImpassableDiscrete(i, j, Math.abs(Math.floor(radius/getWidth()*getPassableMap()[0].length)))))))

    addAsObject

    public void addAsObject(GameObject object)

    hasAsObject

    public boolean hasAsObject(GameObject object)
    Checks whether the given object is in this world.

    Parameters:
    object - The object to check for.
    Returns:
    true if the given object is in the world.
        this.getGameObjects().contains(object)

    getGameObjects

    public java.util.Set<GameObject> getGameObjects()
    Returns all of the game objects in this world.

    Returns:
    this.getWorms() + this.getFood()

    addAsWorm

    public void addAsWorm(Worm worm)
    Add the given worm to the world at a location adjacent to an impassable area of the world.

    Parameters:
    worm - The worm to be added to the world.
    Effect:
    The worm will be added to the set of worms at a location determined by findNewLocation.
        findNewLocation(worm)
        worms.add(worm)

    removeAsWorm

    public void removeAsWorm(Worm worm)
                  throws java.lang.ClassCastException,
                         java.lang.NullPointerException
    Remove the given worm from the set of worms.

    Parameters:
    worm - The worm to be removed.
    Effect:
    The worm is removed from this world.
        this.worms.remove(worm)
    Throws:
    java.lang.ClassCastException
    java.lang.NullPointerException

    isValidWidth

    public static boolean isValidWidth(double width)
    Checks if the given width is a valid value for the width of a world.

    Parameters:
    width - The value to be tested.
    Returns:
    True if and only if the provided width is between 0 and Double.MAX_VALUE.
        ( ! Double.isNaN(width)) && (width >= 0.0) && (width <= Double.MAX_VALUE)

    getWidth

    @Basic
@Raw
public double getWidth()
    A getter for the width of the world.

    Returns:
    The width of the world.

    public static boolean isValidHeight(double height)
    Checks if the given height is a valid value for the height of a world.

    Parameters:
    height - The value to be tested.
    Returns:
    True if and only if the provided height is between 0 and Double.MAX_VALUE.
        ( ! Double.isNaN(height)) && (height >= 0.0) && (height <= Double.MAX_VALUE)
